page.title: 17DRILLING FOR OIL
page.content: A million pound gamble,drilling for oil in the Weeton-Harewood area was approved in July 1983 and a licence issued lasting for 30 years.The chance of finding oil in sufficient quantity for economic use was 1 in 16. The depth of drilling was 8500 feet. The site was little larger than a football field.The rig towered upwards for 135 feet.The drilling continued for 4 to 5 months.15 men were employed on a shift basis;5 men for each 12 hours,working round the clock, under floodlights at night. The residents of neighbouring villages were worried about the noise, the heavy traffic along the country lanes and the possible disfigurement of the beautiful landscape. The hoped-for 10 million barrels of oil were not available.Subsequently no more drilling will take place.
